contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|LCS}} {{tocright}} '''LCS''' may refer to: ==Schools and organizations== * [[Lakefield College School]] an independent school in Lakefield, Ontario, Canada * [[Language Creation Society]], a nonprofit for people who make conlangs * [[Lebanese Community School]] in Lagos, Nigeria * [[Lincoln Christian College and Seminary]] * [[Lincoln Community School]] in Accra, Ghana * [[Littlehampton Community School]], large secondary school in West Sussex, England * [[Littleover Community School]] in Derby, England * [[Lockerby Composite School]] Canadian Secondary School in Ontario * [[London Controlling Section]], a British World War II secret organisation * [[London Corresponding Society]], a radical British society founded in 1792 * [[Lutheran Confessional Synod]], type of church * [[Lynden Christian Schools]] * [[Project MAC]] (Laboratory for Computer Science) at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology ==Science, mathematics, and computing== * [[Laser Camera System]], a type of scanner used on the Space Shuttle * [[Lagrangian coherent structure]], in fluid mechanics, a type of flow structure * [[Learning classifier system]], machine learning system * [[Liquid cooling (disambiguation)|Liquid cooling system (disambiguation)]], various meanings * [[Live Communications Server]], [[Live Communications Server 2005]] or [[Microsoft Office Communications Server]], a secure Session Initiation Protocol based instant messaging and VoIP server product * [[Locally convex space]] * [[Longest common substring problem]] in computer science, the longest shared sequence of consecutive characters * [[Longest common subsequence problem]] in computer science, the longest shared sequence of not necessarily consecutive characters ==Sports and entertainment== * ''[[Grand Theft Auto: Liberty City Stories]]'', a game for the PlayStation Portable and PlayStation 2 * [[League Championship Series]], a round of playoffs in Major League Baseball * ''[[Last Comic Standing]]'', an NBC reality program that premiered in 2003 * ''[[Liberal Crime Squad]]'', an ASCII based game * ''[[League of Legends Championship Series]]'', eSports events for the MOBA game League of Legends. See: http://lolesports.com/ ==Other uses== * [[Landing Craft Support]], amphibious landing support ship, from World War II * LCS, a psychology credential for "Licensed Clinical Social Worker". See [[List of credentials in psychology]] * [[Littoral Combat Ship]], a type of United States warship ==See also== * [[LC (disambiguation)]] {{disambiguation}}
